error.signature: Error [ERR_REQUIRE_ESM]: require() of ES Module not supported

verdict.summary: Trying to require() an ES module from CommonJS code â€” the imported package has switched to ESM-only.

dead_ends.action: Pinning to the last CJS version of the package
dead_ends.why_fails: Misses security patches and features in newer versions

dead_ends.action: Patching the package to add CJS exports
dead_ends.why_fails: Will be overwritten on npm install; maintenance burden

workarounds.action: Use dynamic import(): const pkg = await import('package')
workarounds.how: Dynamic import() works in both CJS and ESM contexts

workarounds.action: Convert your project to ESM: add 'type': 'module' to package.json
workarounds.how: Use import/export syntax throughout your project

frequently_confused_with.distinction: '[ERR_REQUIRE_ESM]' indicates a require() call on an ES module, while '[ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND]' indicates a missing Node.js module.
'[ERR_REQUIRE_ESM]' indicates a require() call on an ES module, while 'Error' indicates system memory exhaustion.
